benchmark_details.name: MultiModal- Cognitive Support Conversation (M2CoSC)
benchmark_details.overview: M2CoSC is a novel multimodal conversational cognitive reframing dataset that pairs synthetic dialogues generated by LLMs with corresponding images reflecting clients' facial expressions, aimed at enhancing AI psychotherapy.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To enhance the therapeutic capabilities of AI in psychotherapy by integrating multimodal cognitive reframing methods that utilize non-verbal cues.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset is limited to virtual clients whose facial images and dialogues are consistent, and it does not fully capture the complexities of real-world interactions.

data.source: Synthetic dialogues generated with LLMs paired with facial expression images created using DALL-E 3.
data.annotation: Data cleansing was conducted by native English speakers to ensure dialogue clarity and consistency.

methodology.calculation: Metrics were calculated based on a scoring system evaluating empathy, logical coherence, and guidance.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in effectively capturing client-emotional states and providing rational, empathetic interventions.
methodology.baseline_results: The dataset serves as a baseline for evaluation against models trained with multimodal inputs compared to standard text-only models.
methodology.validation: Model performance was validated through extensive evaluation involving both human experts and GPT-4.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The dataset includes implications for biases in facial expression recognition across cultures.
targeted_risks.harm: Inadequate response to client crises and failure to provide forward-looking strategies were observed as potential harms.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: The dataset's images were generated and do not use real client data, adhering to privacy protocols.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: All generated data was produced under consent protocols with simulated interactions.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: The study complies with ethical guidelines for AI usage in mental health.
